cs113.calendar.model
Class SerializableAppointment

java.lang.Object
  cs113.calendar.model.Appointment
      cs113.calendar.model.SerializableAppointment
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Appointment>
public class SerializableAppointment
extends Appointment
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Appointment stored as a serialized Java object.

Author:
Michael Koval
See Also:
Appointment, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

SerializableAppointment

protected SerializableAppointment(java.lang.String desc,
                                  java.lang.String loc,
                                  java.util.Calendar start,
                                  java.util.Calendar end)
                           throws InvalidDateException
Constructs a new appointment that is stored as a serialized Java object.

Parameters:
desc - short description of this appointment or an empty string to indicate that there is no description
loc - location where this appointment occurs or null if this appointment is not related to any specific location
start - starting date and time of the appointment
end - ending date and time of the appointment, must occur after the starting time of the appointment
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if desc, start, or end are null
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the ending time of this appointment does not occur after the starting time
InvalidDateException

setDescription

public void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
Description copied from class: Appointment
Sets the description of this appointment to an arbitrary value. Must not be null: events with no description should return an empty string.

Specified by:
setDescription in class Appointment

setDuration

public void setDuration(java.util.Calendar start,
                        java.util.Calendar end)
                 throws InvalidDateException
Description copied from class: Appointment
Changes the start and ending times of this event. An event's ending time must be after the event's starting time.

Specified by:
setDuration in class Appointment
Parameters:
start - beginning of this appointment
end - end of this appointment
Throws:
InvalidDateException - if the starting time exceeds the ending time
java.lang.NullPointerException - if either time is null
See Also:
Appointment.setDuration(java.util.Calendar, java.util.Calendar)

setLocation

Parameters:
